story.storybody:
extends it to gaushalas

Chandigarh, June 1 (PTI) Haryana government today decided to withdraw exemption to its buildings and establishments from paying municipal taxes even as it extended the benefit to gaushalas (cowshed), and religious instititions.

These and several other key decisions were taken at a meeting on property tax under Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar here, an official release said.

In another significant decision, it was decided to give freedom to municipal corporation and councils to fix rates of property tax depending on the area and value of property.

Till now, the state government used to do it. The state government would henceforth fix only the floor and the ceiling rates of properties.

The Chief Minister directed officers of Urban Local Bodies Department to exempt gaushalas from the payment of taxes, the release said.

Similarly, religious institutions like temple, gurudwara, and mosque should also be exempt from payment of tax provided they are not being used for any commercial purposes, it added.

He also directed the officers to levy minimum property tax on working women hostels in the state.

In the meeting, Khattar also directed the officers to prepare a scheme for auto-debit of payment of property and other taxes through banks.

He said the scheme would facilitate the government to automatically debit the payment from the account of beneficiaries on account of various services being provided by different government departments.

This, he said, would help in save time and money on generation of bill and its payment. He said initially, the scheme should be started in government to government mode.

Later on, the scope of the scheme should be expanded. PTI SUN TIR ZMN TIR
